source: 211 Connecting Point, VA Southeast Louisiana, Louisiana Department of Health, Military OneSource, and Louisiana Veterans Affairs

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: VA Southeast Louisiana Health Care
resources.address: Multiple locations in New Orleans, Baton Rouge, Houma, Slidell
resources.description: Comprehensive medical care, mental health services, homeless veteran care, and benefits assistance with a center of excellence for veteran-focused mental health

resources.name: Louisiana Department of Veterans Affairs (LDVA)
resources.description: State agency providing Louisiana-based resources and services for veterans and their families

resources.name: Louisiana Housing Authority - HUD-VASH Program
resources.description: HUD-Veterans Affairs Supportive Housing vouchers enabling homeless veterans and families to access affordable housing with supportive services partnering with VA Health Care

resources.name: 211 Louisiana (2-1-1)
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referrals for community resources including housing, food, health, employment, legal aid, and veteran services

resources.name: Military OneSource
resources.description: Provides confidential nonmedical counseling to service members and their families, as well as comprehensive information about all aspects of military life

resources.name: U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs - National Resources
resources.description: Nationwide services and resources for veterans and families including healthcare, benefits, homeless services

resources.name: SAMHSA Service Members, Veterans, and Families Technical Assistance Center
resources.description: Assists in finding behavioral health resources and services, provider training, webinars, and behavioral health identification

resources.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
resources.description: 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress with crisis support and prevention resources

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Employment assistance and job placement services for veterans overcoming employment barriers

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

additional_resources.hud_vash_program: https://www.va.gov/homeless/hud-vash.asp - Housing vouchers with VA services
additional_resources.homeless_veteran_hotline: 1-877-424-3838 - National Call Center for Homeless Veterans

notes: This directory includes major state and federal veteran resources in Louisiana. For county-specific services, call 211 or contact VA Southeast Louisiana at 1-888-823-4072. Many services are free and confidential.
